snippet.title: Frogs and Buns
snippet.description:
This is an experimental video to try to motivate a need for adding fractions with unlike denominators. (It also leads into the historical questions and deep mathematical questions of Egyptian fractions.) 
This video might be odd without context or a possible lesson structure presented with it. Or maybe it stands alone just fine to evoke interesting classroom discussion: How would you share ten buns among 12 people so as to avoid giving people fiddly bits of bun? Is there a clear one correct answer? (And, are you naturally finding yourself adding fractions with unlike denominators as you explore your thinking?)
